title: What is included in a Thyroid Test Package?

content.title: In our comprehensive Thyroid Test package, Assure Pathlabs provides you with a range of tests that focus on thyroid health. Our package includes essential assessments, such as:
points: Thyroid Stimulating Hormone (TSH) test to evaluate thyroid function.
Free T3 and Free T4 tests to assess thyroid hormone levels.
Thyroid antibody tests to check for autoimmune thyroid conditions.

title: Why is a Thyroid Test necessary?

content.title: A Thyroid Test is crucial because it helps in diagnosing thyroid disorders that can affect various aspects of health. By undergoing regular thyroid tests, individuals can detect thyroid problems early on, allowing for timely management and treatment. title: What do abnormal Thyroid Test results indicate?

content.title: Abnormal results may indicate an overactive (hyperthyroidism) or underactive (hypothyroidism) thyroid. Elevated antibody levels may suggest autoimmune thyroid conditions. Interpretation of results should be done by a qualified healthcare professional.

Yes, many thyroid disorders can be effectively treated. Treatment may involve medications to regulate hormone levels, lifestyle changes, or, in some cases, surgical intervention. A healthcare provider will determine the most suitable treatment plan based on the diagnosis.

title: What is the normal range of T3 T4 and TSH?

content.title: The normal ranges for T3 (Trilodothyronine) is 60-181ng/dl, T4 (Thyroxine) is 4.5-12.6ng/dl, TSH (Ultrasensitive) is 0.13-6.33uIU/ml.

title: Is fasting required for T3 T4 & TSH test?

content.title: Generally, you don't need to fast before doing a Thyroid Function Test.

title: Can I drink water before Thyroid Test?

content.title: Yes, you can have water before a Thyroid Test.
